definitions.definition: The state of organisms preceding their death , characterized by biological processes such as metabolism and reproduction and distinguishing them from inanimate objects ; the state of being alive and living .
examples: I want my kids to live a good life . He gave up on life .

subdefinitions.definition: The status possessed by any of a number of entities, including animals , plants , fungi , bacteria , and sometimes viruses , which have the properties of replication and metabolism .

definitions.definition: The animating principle or force that keeps an inorganic thing or concept metaphorically alive ( dynamic , relevant , etc) and makes it a " living document ", "living constitution", etc.
A living being ; the fact of a particular individual being alive. ( Chiefly when indicating individuals were lost (died) or saved. )
examples: Many lives were lost during the war.   Her quick thinking saved many dogs' lives .
He gets up early in the morning, works all day long — even on weekends — and hardly sees his family. That's no life ! His life was ruined by drugs.

subdefinitions.definition: Something which is inherently part of a person's existence, such as job, family, a loved one, etc.

definitions.definition: A period of time during which something has existence.

subdefinitions.definition: The period during which one (a person, an animal, a plant; a civilization, species; a star; etc) is alive .
The span of time during which an object operates.
examples: This light bulb is designed to have a life of 2,000 hours.

subdefinitions.definition: The period of time during which an object is recognizable.
examples: The life of this milk carton may be thousands of years in this landfill.

subdefinitions.definition: A particular phase or period of existence.

A period extending from a when a (positive or negative) office, punishment, etc is conferred on someone until that person dies (or, sometimes, reaches retirement age). ( colloquial ) A life sentence ; a period of imprisonment that lasts until the convict's death (or, sometimes, parole ).
The most lively component or participant.

examples: His life of the founder is finished, except for the title.

definitions.definition: Nature , reality , and the forms that exist in it.

subdefinitions.definition: One of the player 's chances to play, lost when the player's character dies or when certain mistakes are made.
examples: Scoring 1000 points is rewarded with an extra life .

subdefinitions.definition: A chance for the batter (or batting team) to bat again, given as a result of a misplay by a member of the fielding team.
One of a player's chances to play in various children's playground games, lost when a mistake is made, for example being struck by the ball in dodgeball .

definitions.definition: A life assured under a life assurance policy (equivalent to the policy itself for a single life contract).

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The state of organisms preceding their death , characterized by biological processes such as metabolism and reproduction and distinguishing them from inanimate objects ; the state of being alive and living .
secondary_definitions: The animating principle or force that keeps an inorganic thing or concept metaphorically alive ( dynamic , relevant , etc) and makes it a " living document ", "living constitution", etc.
( countable ) A living being ; the fact of a particular individual being alive. ( Chiefly when indicating individuals were lost (died) or saved. )
A period of time during which something has existence.
Nature , reality , and the forms that exist in it.
( uncountable , insurance ) The life insurance industry.
( countable ) A life assured under a life assurance policy (equivalent to the policy itself for a single life contract).
